edu.up.cs301.game
Class LocalGame

java.lang.Object
  edu.up.cs301.game.LocalGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Game, Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TTTLocalGame
public abstract class LocalGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game, Tickable

A class that knows how to play the game. The data in this class represent the state of a game. The state represented by an instance of this class can be a complete state (as might be used by the main game activity) or a partial state as it would be seen from the perspective of an individual player. Each game has a unique state definition, so this abstract base class has little inherent functionality.

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Steven R. Vegdahl, Andrew Nuxoll

Specified by:
start in interface Game
Parameters:
players - the list of players who are playing in the game

sendUpdatedStateTo

protected abstract void sendUpdatedStateTo(GamePlayer p)
Notify the given player that its state has changed. This should involve sending a GameInfo object to the player. If the game is not a perfect-information game this method should remove any information from the game that the player is not allowed to know.

Parameters:
p - the player to notify

sendAllUpdatedState

protected final void sendAllUpdatedState()
Notify all players that the game's state has changed. Typically this simply calls the 'notifyStateChanged' method for each player.

getPlayerIdx

protected final int getPlayerIdx(GamePlayer p)
Determines the numeric player ID (0 through whatever) for the given player.

Parameters:
p - the player whose player ID we want
Returns:
the player's ID, or -1 if the player is not a player in this game

canMove

protected abstract boolean canMove(int playerIdx)
Tell whether the given player is allowed to make a move at the present point in the game.

Parameters:
playerIdx - the player's player-number (ID)
Returns:
true iff the player is allowed to move

checkIfGameOver

protected abstract java.lang.String checkIfGameOver()
Check if the game is over. It is over, return a string that tells who the winner(s), if any, are. If the game is not over, return null;

Returns:
a message that tells who has won the game, or null if the game is not over

makeMove

protected abstract boolean makeMove(GameAction action)
Makes a move on behalf of a player.

Parameters:
action - The move that the player has sent to the game
Returns:
Tells whether the move was a legal one.

timerTicked

protected void timerTicked()
Invoked whenever the game's timer has ticked. It is expected that this will be overridden in many games.
